result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tayana A Thomas

records.addlTxt:
3:46 PM Defendant Tayana A Thomas in court.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised to apply for SPD. Defendant waives time limits. Notice given in-hand. 
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:49 PM Defendant Tayana A Thomas in court.  Attorney Christopher William Duren in court for Tayana A Thomas.  Attorney Al Homsi in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duren has not been appointed yet and has not reviewed the complaint. Matter to be re-set for a preliminary hearing.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AB.
- Defendant shall not be on the 5100 block of Milwaukee St. in Madison.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 17

2:28 PM Defendant Tayana A. Thomas in court, in custody.  Attorney Guy Cardamone in court for Tayana A. Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
